DataElement.preferredName: Acute Myeloid Leukemia Transplantation Time Status Acute Leukemia Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the status of the acute myeloid leukemia at the time of transplantation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Myeloid Leukemia Transplantation Time Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues.  The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia 3) Therapy-related AML 4) AML not otherwise categorized.  The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML has been recently reduced from 30% (French-American-British [FAB] classification) to 20% (WHO classification).  (WHO, 2001)_The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues.  The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia 3) Therapy-related AML 4) AML not otherwise categorized.  The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML has been recently reduced from 30% (French-American-British [FAB] classification) to 20% (WHO classification).  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise specified. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification).

Property.preferredDefinition: The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
A condition or state at a particular time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clonal (malignant) hematopoietic disorder affecting the bone marrow and the peripheral blood.  The malignant cells show minimal differentiation and are called blasts, either myeloid blasts (myeloblasts) or lymphoid blasts (lymphoblasts).  According to the type of blasts present, acute leukemias are classified as acute myeloid leukemia (AML) and precursor lymphoblastic or acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL)._A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: leukemia in which the involved cell shows little or no differentiation, usually consisting of blast cells; two types are distinguished, acute lymphocytic and acute myelogenous leukemia.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A clonal (malignant) hematopoietic disorder with an acute onset, affecting the bone marrow and the peripheral blood.  The malignant cells show minimal differentiation and are called blasts, either myeloid blasts (myeloblasts) or lymphoid blasts (lymphoblasts).
A condition or state at a particular time.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Artificial Neural Network Algorithm for BRIDG Mapping

ReferenceDocuments.name: What was the status of the ac
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the status of the acute myelogenous leukemia (AML) or acute nonlymphocytic leukemia (ANLL) at the time of transplantation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2685090
ReferenceDocuments.description: "PerformedDiagnosis.diseaseStatusCode WHERE PerformedDiagnosis.value = ""acute myologenous leukemia(AML)"" OR ""acute nonlymphocytic leukemia"" AND PerformedDiagnosis.reportedDate IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO PerformedSubstanceAdministration.dateRange AND PerformedSubstanceAdministration > DefinedSubstanceAdministration.nameCode = ""Administer Hematopoietic Cell Product{ Transplantation}"""
